nodes.bodyText:
I've put the guard in, and fixed the byte/pixels typo.
I think the in-the-query-buffer is already being handled;
https://github.com/geoserver/geoserver/blob/master/src/extension/vectortiles/src/main/java/org/geoserver/wms/vector/PipelineBuilder.java#L298
(NOTE: this might want to be multiplied by the oversample factor, but I'm not sure how people are using it).
The oversample factor is hard coded to 16, which is pretty high.  Perhaps we should drop this to 2 or 4?

nodes.bodyText:
Okay so oversampleX&Y are in part to support the hi-def displays, so a 512x512 "pixel" tile contains 4096x4096 detail (to support those 400 dpi phones do doubt).
So combining these two things: the layer buffer calculated from the style (or supplied by user override) x oversample should be correct.
Only remaining "huh" question is why there are different oversample X and Y...
